title: Vance, Walz kick off anticipated VP debate
summary: History suggests vice presidential debates rarely move the dial much. But in an election campaign that has seen Harris step in for US President Joe Biden unprecedentedly late in the game, Tuesday's contest may have added significance.

title: Hezbollah's four decades of war with Israel
summary: Over the years, the small Shiite guerrilla group developed into a formidable army and even a 'state above a non-state' in Lebanon, according to some Middle East experts.

title: Israel warns residents of southern Beirut to evacuate, says they will also 'continue to strike powerfully' across Middle East'
summary: The Lebanon clash began a year ago when Hezbollah struck northern Israel in support of Hamas after the October 7 attack, which resulted in the worst massacres of Israeli civilians. As for Israel's continuation of strikes in the Middle East, this comes after Iran attacked Israel with scores of missiles just hours earlier on Tuesday.

title: Netanyahu vows to make Tehran 'pay' for missile attack: 'Whoever attacks us, we attack them'
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called Iran's massive missile attack on Israel 'a big mistake' and vowed to make Tehran 'pay for it.' Biden says US is 'fully supportive' of Isarel.

title: 120 people to sue Sean 'Diddy' Combs for sex assault: 'Many dirty secrets will be revealed,' says lawyer
summary: 'The biggest secret in the entertainment industry, that really wasn't a secret at all, has finally been revealed to the world,' Texas-based attorney Tony Buzbee said as he announced plans by 120 people, including 25 minors, to take civil action.

title: Chantal Akerman from all angles
summary: An exhibition at the Jeu de Paume in Paris, the theatrical re-release by Capricci of 16 restored films and a lavish 46-film box set offer an opportunity to revisit the work of the director, who died in 2015.

title: Kremlin increases defense budget by 30%
summary: The 2025 budget bill calls for military spending to account for almost a third of federal spending. At the same time, the Kremlin has called up 130,000 young people for military service.

title: French PM Barnier promises spending cuts and tax hikes to reduce 'colossal' debt
summary: In his first speech to Parliament, Prime Minister Michel Barnier said France would aim to reduce its deficit to 3% of GDP before 2029, two years later than previously planned.

title: Coal: Global consumption still at a record high
summary: China and India, the world's two most populous countries, happen to be the biggest producers and consumers of coal, while simultaneously installing photovoltaic panels and wind turbines.

title: 'The future of the Paris ring road deserves more than a speed limit debate'
summary: The need to adapt urban spaces to cope with climate change requires major changes that meet the global challenges of energy efficiency and metropolitan cohesion, argues urban planner Nathalie Roseau.

title: At French mass rape trial, defendants' partners in denial: 'I don't understand why he's here today'
summary: In their depositions on Monday, the current and former partners of three co-defendants denied any wrongdoing, placing the blame squarely on Dominique Pelicot.

title: World leaders speak out on Israel's Lebanon offensive
summary: Since Israel began 'limited raids' into Lebanon on Monday, September 30, world leaders have issued calls for a ceasefire, called on Israel to stop operations in Lebanese territory, and warned against escalation.

title: Arsenal beat Paris Saint-Germain 2-0 in their heavyweight Champions League duel
summary: The clash between Arsenal and French champions PSG in London was the big game of the day as the second round of matches in the new format of European football's elite club competition got underway.

title: Newly elected Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake expected to distance himself from India
summary: The president's party may be more pro-Beijing than its predecessors. This is a setback for Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and billionaire Gautam Adani.

title: Sheinbaum takes office as Mexico's first woman president
summary: A scientist by training, Claudia Sheinbaum won a landslide victory in June elections with a vow to continue the left-wing reform agenda of outgoing leader Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador, a close ally.

title: 'Price increases reached 20% during Biden's term; under Trump, it could be disastrous too'
summary: The Republican candidate's economic program, which aims to suppress the Fed, deport foreign workers and raise tariffs, is highly inflationary, writes Arnaud Leparmentier, Le Monde's New York correspondent, in his column.

title: US ports strike threatens global shipping and Harris campaign
summary: Main East Coast ports from Houston to Boston have been hit by the strike, with striking dockworkers demanding a 77% pay rise over six years. Logistics experts say the strike could be 'highly damaging' to the economy.

title: In Mexico, President 'AMLO' leaves his successor a dynamic economy but a failing security record
summary: Claudia Sheinbaum succeeds Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Tuesday, a politician whose popularity remains intact after six years in office.

title: How Israel is trying to impose a new regional order in the Middle East
summary: Since 1982, Israelis and Americans have dreamt of 'rebuilding' the region. Yet every attempt to date has had the opposite effect to that which had been expected.

title: In California, the homeless enter the election campaign
summary: A recent Supreme Court decision now gives municipalities in the West the right to criminalize people sleeping in the street. Tent removals are on the increase as Democrats seek to prove to Republicans that they know how to deal with this thorny issue.

title: First steps in France for Wero, the European electronic wallet
summary: Seven major French banks are deploying Wero, which will replace Paylib for payments between private individuals and then be extended to e-commerce and in-store payments. The aim is to compete with the major payment networks, which are mainly American.

title: Danish police investigate two explosions near Israeli embassy
summary: 'Nobody was wounded and we are carrying out a preliminary investigation at the scene,' reported police after explosions went off beside the Israeli embassy in Copenhagen on Wednesday.
